page.title: 02MILTON BRYAN
page.content:
The village of Milton Bryan consists of two parts, with the now disused {school}between them.
The part known as Churchend, contains the 12th century{St. Peters Church, the rectory and Manor Farm. The main village area contains a 17th Century Manor, half timbered cottages and a former{Chapel.}There are no shops.
The parish, which includes the southernmost tip of{Woburn Park,}is about 1500 acres. Over half of this is pasture land.
About 150 people live in the area in about 50 households.
The village is reached by tree-lined minor roads.
